page.title: 11Pendock School saved
page.content: In September 1983 the Local Education Authority were planning to close the school.They went round asking questions.In January 1984 everyone had some big posters on their car windows saying"I am supporting Pendock School".The people of Pendock School had a big folder of why they should keep the school open.The Parents went round all the houses in Pendock and Eldersfield Marsh and on the road up to Ledbury.They knocked on every door to see whether or not more children will be coming to the school.The parents did a five year graph.If the school did close down then we would have to go to school on a taxi and they are very dangerous roads and the parents didn't like that.In the end the school stayed open because the parents found out that there were a lot more children that were coming.
